definition: to announce publicly/to publish/to make known/to disclose
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit

sentences.english: The result of the election has been published.
For all your explanation, you haven't given us the answer.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，說了半天，你也沒有爲大家揭曉答案。

sentences.english: Before giving my opinion, I thellonk it is essential to look at the argument of both sides.
sentences.chinese: 在揭曉我的定見之前，我以爲看兩邊的論據是根本的。

sentences.english: Acouple of months later, on a Saturday in June, came the first answer.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月後，在六月的一個週六，答案揭曉了。

sentences.english: Mr. President? The fate of Jon Snow is about to be revealed in the screening room.
sentences.chinese: 總統先生？雪諾的命運將在放映室揭曉。

sentences.english: King's Speech'"gets royal treatment at Oscars."
sentences.chinese: 奧斯卡提名揭曉，英國影片《國王的演講》先聲奪人。

sentences.english: The 2011 Forward prize shortlist has been announced.
sentences.chinese: 2011年前進詩歌獎最終候選人名單揭曉。

sentences.english: Final results in Ireland will be known on Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 愛爾蘭投票的最終結果將在星期六下午揭曉。

sentences.english: But it’s not like The Wild West, a mystery waiting to be unveiled that will soon lose its luster.
sentences.chinese: 它不像西部荒，是一旦揭曉便會失去光澤的祕密。

sentences.english: Mystery of King Tut's demise solved?
sentences.chinese: 圖特卡蒙法老神祕死因揭曉了？

sentences.english: If you've been wondering about those black stripes on the casings, all is about to be revealed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你一直對管套上的黑條感到疑惑，一切即將揭曉。

sentences.english: The test will be unveiled in Sydney today.
sentences.chinese: 此測試將於今日在悉尼揭曉。

definition: to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to take out of the furnace/fresh out of the oven/fig. newly announced/recently made available
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
